snippet: President Obama said his proposal to extend the Bush-era tax cuts for families making up to $250,000 would strengthen Americans’ finances.
abstract: President Obama, campaigning in Iowa, says his proposal to extend the Bush-era tax cuts for families making up to $250,000 would strengthen Americans’ finances; presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney scores Obama's tax proposal, saying it amounts to a massive tax increase for small businesses.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Cedar Rapids, and Ashley Parker from Grand Junction, Colo.

lead_paragraph: President Obama said his proposal to extend the Bush-era tax cuts for families making up to $250,000 would strengthen Americans’ finances.

headline.seo: Obama Takes His Tax Message to Iowa
headline.main: In an Iowa Dining Room, Obama Puts a Middle-Class Face on a Tax Fight
headline.print_headline: In an Iowa Dining Room, Obama Puts a Middle-Class Face on a Tax Fight
